com.soa.message.header
Interface Header

All Known Subinterfaces:
MutableHeader
public interface Header

This interface represents a generic message header that can be composed of a name and a value or set of values. Values may have parameters that further qualify the value. The general format is defined as: 

 header  = name ":" [ part ] *( "," [ part ] )
 part    = [ ( value | param ) ] *( ";" [ param ] )
 param   = name [ "=" [ value ] ]

 name    = token
 value   = ( token | quoted-string )

 token         = 1*<any char except "=", ",", ";", <">>
 quoted-string = <"> *( text | quoted-char ) <">
 text          = any char except <">
 quoted-char   = "\" char
The part(s) in this case are represented as HeaderParts.

See Also:
HeaderPart, RFC822, RFC2045

Method Summary
 HeaderPart getFirstPart()
          Get the first part for this header
 java.lang.String getName()
          Get the header name
 HeaderPart[] getParts()
          Get the parts that comprise this header
 java.lang.String getValue()
          Get the header value.
 

Method Detail

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Get the header name

Returns:
The name of this header

getValue

java.lang.String getValue()
Get the header value. This is the normalized string value of the header with any component parts concatenated together. If the individual components of the header are required, please use getParts.

Returns:
The normalized string value of the header

getParts

HeaderPart[] getParts()
                      throws GException
Get the parts that comprise this header

Returns:
The set of parts that make up this header. If the header has a single part, the returned array will have a single item corresponding to the name and value returned by this class.
Throws:
GException

getFirstPart

HeaderPart getFirstPart()
                        throws GException
Get the first part for this header

Returns:
The first parts for this header. Many headers will be single-valued so this method is a convenient way to access a parsed version of the header in common cases.
Throws:
GException
